subject: Fashion
title: Marlene Dietrich in a Suit
description: A short lesson to help you apply Marlene Dietrich in a Suit.

hook.text: In 1930, Marlene Dietrich stepped off a train in Paris wearing a man's suit. Crowds gathered to stare.

buildup.text: Her film 'Morocco' showed her in a tuxedo, kissing a woman on screen. The censors were furious.

discovery.text: Dietrich didn't cross-dress for shock. She said trousers were simply more comfortable and practical.

twist.text: Paris police threatened to arrest her for wearing men's clothing. She wore the suit anyway.

climax.text: She proved a woman in a suit could be more powerful and alluring than any evening gown.

punchline.text: She didn't borrow menswear. She claimed it.

quiz.question: How did Marlene Dietrich respond when Paris police threatened arrest for wearing menswear?
options: She changed into a dress to avoid legal trouble
She negotiated a special permit for public appearances
She wore the suit anyway, refusing to comply
